relevant_findings.general: Alert, oriented, mildly diaphoretic and visibly uncomfortable
relevant_findings.neck: Supple, JVP not elevated, no LAD
relevant_findings.lungs: Clear to auscultation bilaterally, no wheezes, rales, ronchi
relevant_findings.cardiovascular: Regular rate and rhythm, normal S1 + S2, no murmurs, rubs, gallops
relevant_findings.abdomen: Soft, TTP in LUQ, non-distended, bowel sounds present, no rebound tenderness or guarding, no organomegaly
relevant_findings.back: TTP w/ CVA tenderness over his L flank, endorses pain in that same place w/ straight leg raise (bilaterally) w/ radiation of the pain down his legs to knees
relevant_findings.extremities: Warm, well perfused, 2+ pulses, no clubbing, cyanosis or edema

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial vital signs evolved with increased blood pressure and decreased heart rate. The patient's discomfort persisted with reported sharp pain and dyspnea.
